Body: Language is acquired as a habit, albeit a much more complex than smoking or sucking your thumb. People develop different styles in speech, because as children they experiment with different ad new usages, some of which they find most comfortable, or which have the ideal cadence. You say "I think" and "usually", because you grew more accustomed to them over "I believe" or "most of the time." For me, when I starting more consistently pronouncing the "h" in "what", "when", "whither", etc., I had to force myself to make the correction; now I must correct myself when I do not.
